}} 'Nathaniel Marvin "Nat" Wolff' (born December 17, 1994) is an American actor,
singer-songwriter, composer, keyboardist, and guitarist. He received a Broadcast
Music Incorporated award, was nominated for one Nickelodeon Kids' Choice
Awardâboth in the United States and the United Kingdomâand two Young Artist
Awards. Wolff also won an award at the Hamptons International Film Festival.

Wolff is critically acclaimed for starring in and composing the music for the
Nickelodeon musical comedy series [[The Naked Brothers Band (TV series)|The
Naked Brothers Band]], which was created and produced by his actress mother
Polly Draper. His jazz pianist father Michael Wolff co-produced two of he and
his brother's soundtrack albums titled [[The Naked Brothers Band (album)|The
Naked Brothers Band]] (2007) and [[I Don't Want to Go to School]] (2008); the
former of which ranked at number 23 on the Top 200 Billboard Charts. Nat and his
younger actor and musician brother Alex Wolff, who also co-starred in the
series, formed a duo called Nat & Alex Wolff and they released an album titled
[[Black Sheep (Nat & Alex Wolff album)|Black Sheep]] in 2011.
